message: Also, it's so new, you can still get one-letter usernames. What's cooler than that?
Hurray for open-source, https://github.com/hotsh/rstat.us complete with mongo, sinatra and coffee-script
Pretty much like the title says. It's Sinatra and Ruby and FOSS and yummy.
And why a microblogging tool which can use twitter to login………………………
We have Twitter, we have status.net(FOSS), we have many microblogging tools. Why more???

@linopolus Why Convore when there is IRC? ;-) As to using Twitter to login, not a bad idea as means you automatically publish to Twitter as well; since it's unlikely Twitter is going to go anywhere. No one complains that there is Posterous, Tumblr, Blogger, Squarespace, and Wordpress, etc. Why not more micro-blogging options?
Just signed up.  This looks very promising.
@atomicules  because convore has additional features. :D
@linopolus ;-) touché
I'd like to see it work something like Google Wave was intended too. I.e. distributed, but possible to communicate between each 'distribution'. Don't know if that is the plan though.
Well, the differentiating factors are 1) Open source and 2) Distributed (eventually)

Having options is fine, but usually those options are different enough that you can choose one because of it.  If you're given two choices, vanilla or vanilla, you better hope that vanilla tastes different than vanilla
yes I know, it's just a general thought that I had. There are tons of examples of "rebellion-projects" which don't have really an impact because end-users are not able to use them.
I'm just not sure what it does that would make me use it in place of twitter.
Otherwise it's just vanilla
@zimbatm as far as I now it's only been in development 10 days. And should be considered very alpha. So it's not for the masses to install themselves. Yet.
@atomicules: 1) doesn't really matter unless normal people can install it on their own servers
1) is reason enough that a lot of people put up with Identi.ca
2) Is a nice goal. It's a bit scary that Twitter is in the hands of one organisation. A commercial one at that. It's almost too important as a communication platform to be centralised.
@locks I've never actually looked at it. I assumed it was more like Facebook just from what I've read.

Find a bug in the rstat.us atom freeds - PuSH hub link points to /publish  - <link rel="hub" href="http://pubsubhubbub.appspot.com/publish"/> . Need to be http://pubsubhubbub.appspot.com/ , /publish is just for debug
done: https://github.com/hotsh/rstat.us/issues/72
@zh why don't you fill an issue report? https://github.com/hotsh/rstat.us/issues
I was curious about diaspora at first, and wishing it'd make privacy levels easy. but it doesn't really, it's hard to use
wishing it'd make privacy levels easy, as opposed to facebook with its opaque and limited privacy options
rstat.us asking users to copy and paste rss feeds to follow someone gives me the exact same impression: http://rstat.us/follow
rebellion projects don't go forward because they're too precious about their values. people shouldn't have to "put up" with it, like eating their greens... they should actually like to use it
I get the impression 1) and 2) are seen as value enough, while usefulness is really the bottom line
@digiberber that's just for following people outside of rstatus. beside it's 10 days old and the main focus was following people *inside* rstatus

I'd still say that if you want adopters, early ones or common ones, whatever you release should be dead simple, no hoops, and an improvement on what's already available. else you'll be loosing people on a first bad impression, like diaspora
@judofyr didn't know it was this young. :) my intention isn't to bash the effort, which I appreciate and am curious about, but to give feedback
btw, how do I follow people inside rstatus?
there's an issue there already about this: https://github.com/hotsh/rstat.us/issues#issue/24
@digiberber ha! I get that now ;-)
I mean *find* ;)
just posted a suggestion to use UserVoice to drive the design: https://github.com/hotsh/rstat.us/issues/82
@atomicules agreed that 1) and 2) are important, but even as a developer I'm not going to use it unless I see an added value in terms of functionality
@atomicules isn't diaspora sorta kinda that?
